datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in global scope.
scope=global

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: sysgrp

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: sysgrp

admin-https-ssl-versions.name: admin-https-ssl-versions
admin-https-ssl-versions.help: Allowed TLS versions for web administration.

admin-https-ssl-ciphersuites.name: admin-https-ssl-ciphersuites
admin-https-ssl-ciphersuites.help: Select one or more TLS 1.3 ciphersuites to enable. Does not affect ciphers in TLS 1.2 and below. At least one must be enabled. To disable all, remove TLS1.3 from admin-https-ssl-versions.

admin-https-ssl-banned-ciphers.name: admin-https-ssl-banned-ciphers
admin-https-ssl-banned-ciphers.help: Select one or more cipher technologies that cannot be used in GUI HTTPS negotiations. Only applies to TLS 1.2 and below.

options.name: RSA
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using RSA key.
options.label: Rsa
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using RSA key

options.name: DHE
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using authenticated ephemeral DH key agreement.
options.label: Dhe
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using authenticated ephemeral DH key agreement

options.name: ECDHE
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using authenticated ephemeral ECDH key agreement.
options.label: Ecdhe
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using authenticated ephemeral ECDH key agreement

options.name: DSS
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using DSS authentication.
options.label: Dss
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using DSS authentication

options.name: ECDSA
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using ECDSA authentication.
options.label: Ecdsa
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using ECDSA authentication

options.name: AES
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using either 128 or 256 bit AES.
options.label: Aes
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using either 128 or 256 bit AES

options.name: AESGCM
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using AES in Galois Counter Mode (GCM).
options.label: Aesgcm
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using AES in Galois Counter Mode (GCM)

options.name: CAMELLIA
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using either 128 or 256 bit CAMELLIA.
options.label: Camellia
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using either 128 or 256 bit CAMELLIA

options.name: 3DES
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using triple DES.
options.label: 3Des
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using triple DES

options.name: SHA1
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA1.
options.label: Sha1
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA1

options.name: SHA256
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA256.
options.label: Sha256
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA256

options.name: SHA384
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA384.
options.label: Sha384
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using HMAC-SHA384

options.name: STATIC
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using static keys.
options.label: Static
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using static keys

options.name: CHACHA20
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using ChaCha20.
options.label: Chacha20
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using ChaCha20

options.name: ARIA
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using ARIA.
options.label: Aria
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using ARIA

options.name: AESCCM
options.help: Ban the use of cipher suites using AESCCM.
options.label: Aesccm
options.description: Ban the use of cipher suites using AESCCM

admintimeout.name: admintimeout
admintimeout.help: Number of minutes before an idle administrator session times out (1 - 480 minutes (8 hours), default = 5). A shorter idle timeout is more secure.

admin-console-timeout.name: admin-console-timeout
admin-console-timeout.help: Console login timeout that overrides the admin timeout value (15 - 300 seconds, default = 0, which disables the timeout).

ssd-trim-freq.name: ssd-trim-freq
ssd-trim-freq.help: How often to run SSD Trim (default = weekly). SSD Trim prevents SSD drive data loss by finding and isolating errors.

ssd-trim-hour.name: ssd-trim-hour
ssd-trim-hour.help: Hour of the day on which to run SSD Trim (0 - 23, default = 1).

ssd-trim-min.name: ssd-trim-min
ssd-trim-min.help: Minute of the hour on which to run SSD Trim (0 - 59, 60 for random).

ssd-trim-weekday.name: ssd-trim-weekday
ssd-trim-weekday.help: Day of week to run SSD Trim.

options.name: sunday
options.label: Sunday
options.description: Sunday    monday:Monday    tuesday:Tuesday    wednesday:Wednesday    thursday:Thursday    friday:Friday    saturday:Saturday

ssd-trim-date.name: ssd-trim-date
ssd-trim-date.help: Date within a month to run ssd trim.

admin-concurrent.name: admin-concurrent
admin-concurrent.help: Enable/disable concurrent administrator logins. Use policy-auth-concurrent for firewall authenticated users.

admin-lockout-threshold.name: admin-lockout-threshold
admin-lockout-threshold.help: Number of failed login attempts before an administrator account is locked out for the admin-lockout-duration.

admin-lockout-duration.name: admin-lockout-duration
admin-lockout-duration.help: Amount of time in seconds that an administrator account is locked out after reaching the admin-lockout-threshold for repeated failed login attempts.

refresh.name: refresh
refresh.help: Statistics refresh interval second(s) in GUI.

daily-restart.name: daily-restart
daily-restart.help: Enable/disable daily restart of FortiGate unit. Use the restart-time option to set the time of day for the restart.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable daily reboot of the FortiGate.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable daily reboot of the FortiGate

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable daily reboot of the FortiGate.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable daily reboot of the FortiGate

options.name: time
options.help: Enable daily restart of WAD workers.
options.label: Time
options.description: Enable daily restart of WAD workers

options.name: memory
options.help: Enable restart of WAD workers based on memory usage.
options.label: Memory
options.description: Enable restart of WAD workers based on memory usage

wad-restart-end-time.name: wad-restart-end-time
wad-restart-end-time.help: WAD workers daily restart end time (hh:mm).

wad-p2s-max-body-size.name: wad-p2s-max-body-size
wad-p2s-max-body-size.help: Maximum size of the body of the local out HTTP request (1 - 32 Mbytes, default = 4).

admin-login-max.name: admin-login-max
admin-login-max.help: Maximum number of administrators who can be logged in at the same time (1 - 100, default = 100).

remoteauthtimeout.name: remoteauthtimeout
remoteauthtimeout.help: Number of seconds that the FortiGate waits for responses from remote RADIUS, LDAP, or TACACS+ authentication servers. (1-300 sec, default = 5).

ldapconntimeout.name: ldapconntimeout
ldapconntimeout.help: Global timeout for connections with remote LDAP servers in milliseconds (1 - 300000, default 500).

batch-cmdb.name: batch-cmdb
batch-cmdb.help: Enable/disable batch mode, allowing you to enter a series of CLI commands that will execute as a group once they are loaded.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable batch mode to execute in CMDB server.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable batch mode to execute in CMDB server

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable batch mode to execute in CMDB server.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable batch mode to execute in CMDB server

multi-factor-authentication.name: multi-factor-authentication
multi-factor-authentication.help: Enforce all login methods to require an additional authentication factor (default = optional).

options.name: optional
options.help: Do not enforce all login methods to require an additional authentication factor (controlled by user settings).
options.label: Optional
options.description: Do not enforce all login methods to require an additional authentication factor (controlled by user settings)

options.name: mandatory
options.help: Enforce all login methods to require an additional authentication factor.
options.label: Mandatory
options.description: Enforce all login methods to require an additional authentication factor

ssl-min-proto-version.name: ssl-min-proto-version
ssl-min-proto-version.help: Minimum supported protocol version for SSL/TLS connections (default = TLSv1.2).

autorun-log-fsck.name: autorun-log-fsck
autorun-log-fsck.help: Enable/disable automatic log partition check after ungraceful shutdown.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable automatic log partition check after ungraceful shutdown.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable automatic log partition check after ungraceful shutdown

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable automatic log partition check after ungraceful shutdown.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable automatic log partition check after ungraceful shutdown

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.help: Timezone database name. Enter ? to view the list of timezone.

traffic-priority.name: traffic-priority
traffic-priority.help: Choose Type of Service (ToS) or Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) for traffic prioritization in traffic shaping.

traffic-priority-level.name: traffic-priority-level
traffic-priority-level.help: Default system-wide level of priority for traffic prioritization.

quic-udp-payload-size-shaping-per-cid.name: quic-udp-payload-size-shaping-per-cid
quic-udp-payload-size-shaping-per-cid.help: Enable/disable UDP payload size shaping per connection ID (default = enable).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable UDP payload size shaping per connection ID.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable UDP payload size shaping per connection ID

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable UDP payload size shaping per connection ID.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable UDP payload size shaping per connection ID

quic-ack-thresold.name: quic-ack-thresold
quic-ack-thresold.help: Maximum number of unacknowledged packets before sending ACK (2 - 5, default = 3).

quic-tls-handshake-timeout.name: quic-tls-handshake-timeout
quic-tls-handshake-timeout.help: Time-to-live (TTL) for TLS handshake in seconds (1 - 60, default = 5).

anti-replay.name: anti-replay
anti-replay.help: Level of checking for packet replay and TCP sequence checking.

send-pmtu-icmp.name: send-pmtu-icmp
send-pmtu-icmp.help: Enable/disable sending of path maximum transmission unit (PMTU) - ICMP destination unreachable packet and to support PMTUD protocol on your network to reduce fragmentation of packets.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable sending of PMTU ICMP destination unreachable packet.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable sending of PMTU ICMP destination unreachable packet

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable sending of PMTU ICMP destination unreachable packet.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable sending of PMTU ICMP destination unreachable packet

revision-image-auto-backup.name: revision-image-auto-backup
revision-image-auto-backup.help: Enable/disable back-up of the latest image revision after the firmware is upgraded.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable revision image backup automatically when upgrading image.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable revision image backup automatically when upgrading image

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable revision image backup automatically when upgrading image.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable revision image backup automatically when upgrading image

revision-backup-on-logout.name: revision-backup-on-logout
revision-backup-on-logout.help: Enable/disable back-up of the latest configuration revision when an administrator logs out of the CLI or GUI.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable revision config backup automatically when logout.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable revision config backup automatically when logout

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable revision config backup automatically when logout.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable revision config backup automatically when logout

hostname.name: hostname
hostname.help: FortiGate unit's hostname. Most models will truncate names longer than 24 characters. Some models support hostnames up to 35 characters.

strong-crypto.name: strong-crypto
strong-crypto.help: Enable to use strong encryption and only allow strong ciphers and digest for HTTPS/SSH/TLS/SSL functions.

ssl-static-key-ciphers.name: ssl-static-key-ciphers
ssl-static-key-ciphers.help: Enable/disable static key ciphers in SSL/TLS connections (e.g. AES128-SHA, AES256-SHA, AES128-SHA256, AES256-SHA256).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable static key ciphers in SSL/TLS connections.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable static key ciphers in SSL/TLS connections

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable static key ciphers in SSL/TLS connections.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable static key ciphers in SSL/TLS connections

snat-route-change.name: snat-route-change
snat-route-change.help: Enable/disable the ability to change the source NAT route.

ipv6-snat-route-change.name: ipv6-snat-route-change
ipv6-snat-route-change.help: Enable/disable the ability to change the IPv6 source NAT route.

dh-params.name: dh-params
dh-params.help: Number of bits to use in the Diffie-Hellman exchange for HTTPS/SSH protocols.

fds-statistics.name: fds-statistics
fds-statistics.help: Enable/disable sending IPS, Application Control, and AntiVirus data to FortiGuard. This data is used to improve FortiGuard services and is not shared with external parties and is protected by Fortinet's privacy policy.

fds-statistics-period.name: fds-statistics-period
fds-statistics-period.help: FortiGuard statistics collection period in minutes. (1 - 1440 min (1 min to 24 hours), default = 60).

tcp-option.name: tcp-option
tcp-option.help: Enable SACK, timestamp and MSS TCP options.

lldp-transmission.name: lldp-transmission
lldp-transmission.help: Enable/disable Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) transmission.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable transmission of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable transmission of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP)

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable transmission of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable transmission of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP)

lldp-reception.name: lldp-reception
lldp-reception.help: Enable/disable Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) reception.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable reception of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable reception of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP)

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable reception of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP).
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable reception of Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP)

proxy-auth-timeout.name: proxy-auth-timeout
proxy-auth-timeout.help: Authentication timeout in minutes for authenticated users (1 - 10000 min, default = 10).

proxy-keep-alive-mode.name: proxy-keep-alive-mode
proxy-keep-alive-mode.help: Control if users must re-authenticate after a session is closed, traffic has been idle, or from the point at which the user was authenticated.

options.name: session
options.help: Proxy keep-alive timeout begins at the closure of the session.
options.label: Session
options.description: Proxy keep-alive timeout begins at the closure of the session

options.name: traffic
options.help: Proxy keep-alive timeout begins after traffic has not been received.
options.label: Traffic
options.description: Proxy keep-alive timeout begins after traffic has not been received

options.name: re-authentication
options.help: Proxy keep-alive timeout begins when the user was authenticated.
options.label: Re Authentication
options.description: Proxy keep-alive timeout begins when the user was authenticated

proxy-re-authentication-time.name: proxy-re-authentication-time
proxy-re-authentication-time.help: The time limit that users must re-authenticate if proxy-keep-alive-mode is set to re-authenticate (1  - 86400 sec, default=30s.

proxy-auth-lifetime.name: proxy-auth-lifetime
proxy-auth-lifetime.help: Enable/disable authenticated users lifetime control. This is a cap on the total time a proxy user can be authenticated for after which re-authentication will take place.

proxy-auth-lifetime-timeout.name: proxy-auth-lifetime-timeout
proxy-auth-lifetime-timeout.help: Lifetime timeout in minutes for authenticated users (5  - 65535 min, default=480 (8 hours)).

proxy-resource-mode.name: proxy-resource-mode
proxy-resource-mode.help: Enable/disable use of the maximum memory usage on the FortiGate unit's proxy processing of resources, such as block lists, allow lists, and external resources.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of the maximum memory usage.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable use of the maximum memory usage

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of the maximum memory usage.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable use of the maximum memory usage

proxy-cert-use-mgmt-vdom.name: proxy-cert-use-mgmt-vdom
proxy-cert-use-mgmt-vdom.help: Enable/disable using management VDOM to send requests.

sys-perf-log-interval.name: sys-perf-log-interval
sys-perf-log-interval.help: Time in minutes between updates of performance statistics logging. (1 - 15 min, default = 5, 0 = disabled).

check-protocol-header.name: check-protocol-header
check-protocol-header.help: Level of checking performed on protocol headers. Strict checking is more thorough but may affect performance. Loose checking is OK in most cases.

vip-arp-range.name: vip-arp-range
vip-arp-range.help: Controls the number of ARPs that the FortiGate sends for a Virtual IP (VIP) address range.

options.name: unlimited
options.help: Send ARPs for all addresses in VIP range.
options.label: Unlimited
options.description: Send ARPs for all addresses in VIP range

options.name: restricted
options.help: Send ARPs for the first 8192 addresses in VIP range.
options.label: Restricted
options.description: Send ARPs for the first 8192 addresses in VIP range

reset-sessionless-tcp.name: reset-sessionless-tcp
reset-sessionless-tcp.help: Action to perform if the FortiGate receives a TCP packet but cannot find a corresponding session in its session table. NAT/Route mode only.

allow-traffic-redirect.name: allow-traffic-redirect
allow-traffic-redirect.help: Disable to prevent traffic with same local ingress and egress interface from being forwarded without policy check.

ipv6-allow-traffic-redirect.name: ipv6-allow-traffic-redirect
ipv6-allow-traffic-redirect.help: Disable to prevent IPv6 traffic with same local ingress and egress interface from being forwarded without policy check.

strict-dirty-session-check.name: strict-dirty-session-check
strict-dirty-session-check.help: Enable to check the session against the original policy when revalidating. This can prevent dropping of redirected sessions when web-filtering and authentication are enabled together. If this option is enabled, the FortiGate unit deletes a session if a routing or policy change causes the session to no longer match the policy that originally allowed the session.

tcp-halfclose-timer.name: tcp-halfclose-timer
tcp-halfclose-timer.help: Number of seconds the FortiGate unit should wait to close a session after one peer has sent a FIN packet but the other has not responded (1 - 86400 sec (1 day), default = 120).

tcp-halfopen-timer.name: tcp-halfopen-timer
tcp-halfopen-timer.help: Number of seconds the FortiGate unit should wait to close a session after one peer has sent an open session packet but the other has not responded (1 - 86400 sec (1 day), default = 10).

tcp-timewait-timer.name: tcp-timewait-timer
tcp-timewait-timer.help: Length of the TCP TIME-WAIT state in seconds (1 - 300 sec, default = 1).

tcp-rst-timer.name: tcp-rst-timer
tcp-rst-timer.help: Length of the TCP CLOSE state in seconds (5 - 300 sec, default = 5).

udp-idle-timer.name: udp-idle-timer
udp-idle-timer.help: UDP connection session timeout. This command can be useful in managing CPU and memory resources (1 - 86400 seconds (1 day), default = 60).

block-session-timer.name: block-session-timer
block-session-timer.help: Duration in seconds for blocked sessions (1 - 300 sec  (5 minutes), default = 30).

ip-src-port-range.name: ip-src-port-range
ip-src-port-range.help: IP source port range used for traffic originating from the FortiGate unit.

pre-login-banner.name: pre-login-banner
pre-login-banner.help: Enable/disable displaying the administrator access disclaimer message on the login page before an administrator logs in.

post-login-banner.name: post-login-banner
post-login-banner.help: Enable/disable displaying the administrator access disclaimer message after an administrator successfully logs in.

av-failopen.name: av-failopen
av-failopen.help: Set the action to take if the FortiGate is running low on memory or the proxy connection limit has been reached.

options.name: pass
options.help: Bypass the antivirus system when memory is low. Antivirus scanning resumes when the low memory condition is resolved.
options.label: Pass
options.description: Bypass the antivirus system when memory is low

options.name: off
options.help: Stop accepting new AV sessions when entering conserve mode, but continue to process current active sessions.
options.label: Off
options.description: Stop accepting new AV sessions when entering conserve mode, but continue to process current active sessions

options.name: one-shot
options.help: Bypass the antivirus system when memory is low.
options.label: One Shot
options.description: Bypass the antivirus system when memory is low

av-failopen-session.name: av-failopen-session
av-failopen-session.help: When enabled and a proxy for a protocol runs out of room in its session table, that protocol goes into failopen mode and enacts the action specified by av-failopen.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable AV fail open session option.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable AV fail open session option

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable AV fail open session option.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable AV fail open session option

memory-use-threshold-extreme.name: memory-use-threshold-extreme
memory-use-threshold-extreme.help: Threshold at which memory usage is considered extreme (new sessions are dropped) (% of total RAM, default = 95).

memory-use-threshold-red.name: memory-use-threshold-red
memory-use-threshold-red.help: Threshold at which memory usage forces the FortiGate to enter conserve mode (% of total RAM, default = 88).

memory-use-threshold-green.name: memory-use-threshold-green
memory-use-threshold-green.help: Threshold at which memory usage forces the FortiGate to exit conserve mode (% of total RAM, default = 82).

ip-fragment-mem-thresholds.name: ip-fragment-mem-thresholds
ip-fragment-mem-thresholds.help: Maximum memory (MB) used to reassemble IPv4/IPv6 fragments.

ip-fragment-timeout.name: ip-fragment-timeout
ip-fragment-timeout.help: Timeout value in seconds for any fragment not being reassembled

ipv6-fragment-timeout.name: ipv6-fragment-timeout
ipv6-fragment-timeout.help: Timeout value in seconds for any IPv6 fragment not being reassembled

cpu-use-threshold.name: cpu-use-threshold
cpu-use-threshold.help: Threshold at which CPU usage is reported (% of total CPU, default = 90).

log-single-cpu-high.name: log-single-cpu-high
log-single-cpu-high.help: Enable/disable logging the event of a single CPU core reaching CPU usage threshold.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging the event of a single CPU core reaching CPU usage threshold.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable logging the event of a single CPU core reaching CPU usage threshold

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable logging the event of a single CPU core reaching CPU usage threshold.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable logging the event of a single CPU core reaching CPU usage threshold

check-reset-range.name: check-reset-range
check-reset-range.help: Configure ICMP error message verification. You can either apply strict RST range checking or disable it.

upgrade-report.name: upgrade-report
upgrade-report.help: Enable/disable the generation of an upgrade report when upgrading the firmware.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable to automatically generate upgrade report when upgrading the firmware.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable to automatically generate upgrade report when upgrading the firmware

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable upgrade report generation when upgrading the firmware.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable upgrade report generation when upgrading the firmware

admin-port.name: admin-port
admin-port.help: Administrative access port for HTTP. (1 - 65535, default = 80).

admin-sport.name: admin-sport
admin-sport.help: Administrative access port for HTTPS. (1 - 65535, default = 443).

admin-host.name: admin-host
admin-host.help: Administrative host for HTTP and HTTPS. When set, will be used in lieu of the client's Host header for any redirection.

admin-https-redirect.name: admin-https-redirect
admin-https-redirect.help: Enable/disable redirection of HTTP administration access to HTTPS.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable redirecting HTTP administration access to HTTPS.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable redirecting HTTP administration access to HTTPS

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable redirecting HTTP administration access to HTTPS.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable redirecting HTTP administration access to HTTPS

admin-hsts-max-age.name: admin-hsts-max-age
admin-hsts-max-age.help: HTTPS Strict-Transport-Security header max-age in seconds. A value of 0 will reset any HSTS records in the browser.When admin-https-redirect is disabled the header max-age will be 0.

admin-ssh-password.name: admin-ssh-password
admin-ssh-password.help: Enable/disable password authentication for SSH admin access.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable password authentication for SSH admin access.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable password authentication for SSH admin access

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable password authentication for SSH admin access.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable password authentication for SSH admin access

admin-restrict-local.name: admin-restrict-local
admin-restrict-local.help: Enable/disable local admin authentication restriction when remote authenticator is up and running (default = disable).

options.name: all
options.help: Enable local admin authentication restriction including console.
options.label: All
options.description: Enable local admin authentication restriction including console

options.name: non-console-only
options.help: Enable local admin authentication restriction excluding console.
options.label: Non Console Only
options.description: Enable local admin authentication restriction excluding console

admin-ssh-port.name: admin-ssh-port
admin-ssh-port.help: Administrative access port for SSH. (1 - 65535, default = 22).

admin-ssh-grace-time.name: admin-ssh-grace-time
admin-ssh-grace-time.help: Maximum time in seconds permitted between making an SSH connection to the FortiGate unit and authenticating (10 - 3600 sec (1 hour), default 120).

admin-telnet-port.name: admin-telnet-port
admin-telnet-port.help: Administrative access port for TELNET. (1 - 65535, default = 23).

admin-forticloud-sso-login.name: admin-forticloud-sso-login
admin-forticloud-sso-login.help: Enable/disable FortiCloud admin login via SSO.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable FortiCloud admin login via SSO.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable FortiCloud admin login via SSO

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable FortiCloud admin login via SSO.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable FortiCloud admin login via SSO

admin-server-cert.name: admin-server-cert
admin-server-cert.help: Server certificate that the FortiGate uses for HTTPS administrative connections.

admin-https-pki-required.name: admin-https-pki-required
admin-https-pki-required.help: Enable/disable admin login method. Enable to force administrators to provide a valid certificate to log in if PKI is enabled. Disable to allow administrators to log in with a certificate or password.

options.name: enable
options.help: Admin users must provide a valid certificate when PKI is enabled for HTTPS admin access.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Admin users must provide a valid certificate when PKI is enabled for HTTPS admin access

options.name: disable
options.help: Admin users can login by providing a valid certificate or password.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Admin users can login by providing a valid certificate or password

wifi-certificate.name: wifi-certificate
wifi-certificate.help: Certificate to use for WiFi authentication.

dhcp-lease-backup-interval.name: dhcp-lease-backup-interval
dhcp-lease-backup-interval.help: DHCP leases backup interval in seconds (10 - 3600, default = 60).

wifi-ca-certificate.name: wifi-ca-certificate
wifi-ca-certificate.help: CA certificate that verifies the WiFi certificate.

auth-ike-saml-port.name: auth-ike-saml-port
auth-ike-saml-port.help: User IKE SAML authentication port (0 - 65535, default = 1001).

auth-keepalive.name: auth-keepalive
auth-keepalive.help: Enable to prevent user authentication sessions from timing out when idle.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of keep alive to extend authentication.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable use of keep alive to extend authentication

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of keep alive to extend authentication.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable use of keep alive to extend authentication

policy-auth-concurrent.name: policy-auth-concurrent
policy-auth-concurrent.help: Number of concurrent firewall use logins from the same user (1 - 100, default = 0 means no limit).

auth-session-limit.name: auth-session-limit
auth-session-limit.help: Action to take when the number of allowed user authenticated sessions is reached.

options.name: logout-inactive
options.help: Logout the most inactive user authenticated sessions.
options.label: Logout Inactive
options.description: Logout the most inactive user authenticated sessions

auth-cert.name: auth-cert
auth-cert.help: Server certificate that the FortiGate uses for HTTPS firewall authentication connections.

clt-cert-req.name: clt-cert-req
clt-cert-req.help: Enable/disable requiring administrators to have a client certificate to log into the GUI using HTTPS.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable require client certificate for GUI login.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable require client certificate for GUI login

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable require client certificate for GUI login.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable require client certificate for GUI login

fortiservice-port.name: fortiservice-port
fortiservice-port.help: FortiService port (1 - 65535, default = 8013). Used by FortiClient endpoint compliance. Older versions of FortiClient used a different port.

cfg-save.name: cfg-save
cfg-save.help: Configuration file save mode for CLI changes.

options.name: revert
options.help: Manually save config and revert the config when timeout.
options.label: Revert
options.description: Manually save config and revert the config when timeout

cfg-revert-timeout.name: cfg-revert-timeout
cfg-revert-timeout.help: Time-out for reverting to the last saved configuration. (10 - 4294967295 seconds, default = 600).

reboot-upon-config-restore.name: reboot-upon-config-restore
reboot-upon-config-restore.help: Enable/disable reboot of system upon restoring configuration.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable reboot of system upon restoring configuration.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable reboot of system upon restoring configuration

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable reboot of system upon restoring configuration.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable reboot of system upon restoring configuration

admin-scp.name: admin-scp
admin-scp.help: Enable/disable SCP support for system configuration backup, restore, and firmware file upload.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable SCP support for system configuration backup, restore, and firmware file upload.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable SCP support for system configuration backup, restore, and firmware file upload

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable SCP support for system configuration backup, restore, and firmware file upload.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable SCP support for system configuration backup, restore, and firmware file upload

wireless-controller.name: wireless-controller
wireless-controller.help: Enable/disable the wireless controller feature to use the FortiGate unit to manage FortiAPs.

wireless-controller-port.name: wireless-controller-port
wireless-controller-port.help: Port used for the control channel in wireless controller mode (wireless-mode is ac). The data channel port is the control channel port number plus one (1024 - 49150, default = 5246).

extender-controller-reserved-network.name: extender-controller-reserved-network
extender-controller-reserved-network.help: Configure reserved network subnet for managed LAN extension FortiExtender units. This is available when the FortiExtender daemon is running.

options.name: disable
options.help: Unlock down new FortiExtender device discovery.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Unlock down new FortiExtender device discovery

options.name: enable
options.help: Lock down new FortiExtender device discovery.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Lock down new FortiExtender device discovery

fortiextender-provision-on-authorization.name: fortiextender-provision-on-authorization
fortiextender-provision-on-authorization.help: Enable/disable automatic provisioning of latest FortiExtender firmware on authorization.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable FortiExtender firmware provision on authorization.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable FortiExtender firmware provision on authorization

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable FortiExtender firmware provision on authorization.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable FortiExtender firmware provision on authorization

switch-controller.name: switch-controller
switch-controller.help: Enable/disable switch controller feature. Switch controller allows you to manage FortiSwitch from the FortiGate itself.

switch-controller-reserved-network.name: switch-controller-reserved-network
switch-controller-reserved-network.help: Configure reserved network subnet for managed switches. This is available when the switch controller is enabled.

dnsproxy-worker-count.name: dnsproxy-worker-count
dnsproxy-worker-count.help: DNS proxy worker count. For a FortiGate with multiple logical CPUs, you can set the DNS process number from 1 to the number of logical CPUs.

httpd-max-worker-count.name: httpd-max-worker-count
httpd-max-worker-count.help: Maximum number of simultaneous HTTP requests that will be served. This number may affect GUI and REST API performance (0 - 128, default = 0 means let system decide).

scanunit-count.name: scanunit-count
scanunit-count.help: Number of scanunits. The range and the default depend on the number of CPUs. Only available on FortiGate units with multiple CPUs.

fgd-alert-subscription.name: fgd-alert-subscription
fgd-alert-subscription.help: Type of alert to retrieve from FortiGuard.

options.name: advisory
options.help: Retrieve FortiGuard advisories, report and news alerts.
options.label: Advisory
options.description: Retrieve FortiGuard advisories, report and news alerts

options.name: new-antivirus-db
options.help: Retrieve FortiGuard AV database release alerts.
options.label: New Antivirus Db
options.description: Retrieve FortiGuard AV database release alerts

options.name: new-attack-db
options.help: Retrieve FortiGuard IPS database release alerts.
options.label: New Attack Db
options.description: Retrieve FortiGuard IPS database release alerts

ipv6-accept-dad.name: ipv6-accept-dad
ipv6-accept-dad.help: Enable/disable acceptance of IPv6 Duplicate Address Detection (DAD).

ipv6-allow-anycast-probe.name: ipv6-allow-anycast-probe
ipv6-allow-anycast-probe.help: Enable/disable IPv6 address probe through Anycast.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable probing of IPv6 address space through Anycast
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable probing of IPv6 address space through Anycast    disable:Disable probing of IPv6 address space through Anycast

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable probing of IPv6 address space through Anycast
options.label: Disable

ipv6-allow-multicast-probe.name: ipv6-allow-multicast-probe
ipv6-allow-multicast-probe.help: Enable/disable IPv6 address probe through Multicast.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable probing of IPv6 address space through Multicast.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable probing of IPv6 address space through Multicast

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable probing of IPv6 address space through Multicast.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable probing of IPv6 address space through Multicast

ipv6-allow-local-in-silent-drop.name: ipv6-allow-local-in-silent-drop
ipv6-allow-local-in-silent-drop.help: Enable/disable silent drop of IPv6 local-in traffic.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable silent drop of IPv6 local-in traffic.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable silent drop of IPv6 local-in traffic

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable silent drop of IPv6 local-in traffic.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable silent drop of IPv6 local-in traffic

csr-ca-attribute.name: csr-ca-attribute
csr-ca-attribute.help: Enable/disable the CA attribute in certificates. Some CA servers reject CSRs that have the CA attribute.

wimax-4g-usb.name: wimax-4g-usb
wimax-4g-usb.help: Enable/disable comparability with WiMAX 4G USB devices.

cert-chain-max.name: cert-chain-max
cert-chain-max.help: Maximum number of certificates that can be traversed in a certificate chain.

sslvpn-max-worker-count.name: sslvpn-max-worker-count
sslvpn-max-worker-count.help: Maximum number of Agentless VPN processes. Upper limit for this value is the number of CPUs and depends on the model. Default value of zero means the sslvpnd daemon decides the number of worker processes.

two-factor-ftk-expiry.name: two-factor-ftk-expiry
two-factor-ftk-expiry.help: FortiToken authentication session timeout (60 - 600 sec (10 minutes), default = 60).

two-factor-email-expiry.name: two-factor-email-expiry
two-factor-email-expiry.help: Email-based two-factor authentication session timeout (30 - 300 seconds (5 minutes), default = 60).

two-factor-sms-expiry.name: two-factor-sms-expiry
two-factor-sms-expiry.help: SMS-based two-factor authentication session timeout (30 - 300 sec, default = 60).

two-factor-fac-expiry.name: two-factor-fac-expiry
two-factor-fac-expiry.help: FortiAuthenticator token authentication session timeout (10 - 3600 seconds (1 hour), default = 60).

two-factor-ftm-expiry.name: two-factor-ftm-expiry
two-factor-ftm-expiry.help: FortiToken Mobile session timeout (1 - 168 hours (7 days), default = 72).

wad-worker-count.name: wad-worker-count
wad-worker-count.help: Number of explicit proxy WAN optimization daemon (WAD) processes. By default WAN optimization, explicit proxy, and web caching is handled by all of the CPU cores in a FortiGate unit.

wad-worker-dev-cache.name: wad-worker-dev-cache
wad-worker-dev-cache.help: Number of cached devices for each ZTNA proxy worker. The default value is tuned by memory consumption. Set the option to 0 to disable the cache.

wad-csvc-cs-count.name: wad-csvc-cs-count
wad-csvc-cs-count.help: Number of concurrent WAD-cache-service object-cache processes.

wad-csvc-db-count.name: wad-csvc-db-count
wad-csvc-db-count.help: Number of concurrent WAD-cache-service byte-cache processes.

wad-source-affinity.name: wad-source-affinity
wad-source-affinity.help: Enable/disable dispatching traffic to WAD workers based on source affinity.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable dispatching traffic to WAD workers based on source affinity.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable dispatching traffic to WAD workers based on source affinity

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable dispatching traffic to WAD workers based on source affinity.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable dispatching traffic to WAD workers based on source affinity

wad-memory-change-granularity.name: wad-memory-change-granularity
wad-memory-change-granularity.help: Minimum percentage change in system memory usage detected by the wad daemon prior to adjusting TCP window size for any active connection.

ip-conflict-detection.name: ip-conflict-detection
ip-conflict-detection.help: Enable/disable logging of IPv4 address conflict detection.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging of IPv4 address conflict detection.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable logging of IPv4 address conflict detection

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable logging of IPv4 address conflict detection.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable logging of IPv4 address conflict detection

miglogd-children.name: miglogd-children
miglogd-children.help: Number of logging (miglogd) processes to be allowed to run. Higher number can reduce performance; lower number can slow log processing time.

log-daemon-cpu-threshold.name: log-daemon-cpu-threshold
log-daemon-cpu-threshold.help: Configure syslog daemon process spawning threshold. Use a percentage threshold of syslogd CPU usage (1 - 99) or set to zero to use dynamic scheduling based on the number of packets in the syslogd queue (default = 0).

special-file-23-support.name: special-file-23-support
special-file-23-support.help: Enable/disable detection of those special format files when using Data Loss Prevention.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable detection of those special format files when using Data Loss Prevention.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable detection of those special format files when using Data Loss Prevention

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable detection of those special format files when using Data Loss Prevention.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable detection of those special format files when using Data Loss Prevention

log-uuid-address.name: log-uuid-address
log-uuid-address.help: Enable/disable insertion of address UUIDs to traffic logs.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable insertion of address UUID to traffic logs.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable insertion of address UUID to traffic logs

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable insertion of address UUID to traffic logs.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable insertion of address UUID to traffic logs

log-ssl-connection.name: log-ssl-connection
log-ssl-connection.help: Enable/disable logging of SSL connection events.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable logging of SSL connection events.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable logging of SSL connection events

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable logging of SSL connection events.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable logging of SSL connection events

gui-rest-api-cache.name: gui-rest-api-cache
gui-rest-api-cache.help: Enable/disable REST API result caching on FortiGate.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable REST API result caching on FortiGate.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable REST API result caching on FortiGate.
options.label: Disable

rest-api-key-url-query.name: rest-api-key-url-query
rest-api-key-url-query.help: Enable/disable support for passing REST API keys through URL query parameters.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable support for passing REST API keys through URL query parameters.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable support for passing REST API keys through URL query parameters

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable support for passing REST API keys through URL query parameters.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable support for passing REST API keys through URL query parameters

arp-max-entry.name: arp-max-entry
arp-max-entry.help: Maximum number of dynamically learned MAC addresses that can be added to the ARP table (131072 - 2147483647, default = 131072).

ha-affinity.name: ha-affinity
ha-affinity.help: Affinity setting for HA daemons (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

bfd-affinity.name: bfd-affinity
bfd-affinity.help: Affinity setting for BFD daemon (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

cmdbsvr-affinity.name: cmdbsvr-affinity
cmdbsvr-affinity.help: Affinity setting for cmdbsvr (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

av-affinity.name: av-affinity
av-affinity.help: Affinity setting for AV scanning (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

wad-affinity.name: wad-affinity
wad-affinity.help: Affinity setting for wad (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

ips-affinity.name: ips-affinity
ips-affinity.help: Affinity setting for IPS (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx; allowed CPUs must be less than total number of IPS engine daemons).

miglog-affinity.name: miglog-affinity
miglog-affinity.help: Affinity setting for logging (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

syslog-affinity.name: syslog-affinity
syslog-affinity.help: Affinity setting for syslog (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

router-affinity.name: router-affinity
router-affinity.help: Affinity setting for BFD/VRRP/BGP/OSPF daemons (hexadecimal value up to 256 bits in the format of xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx).

ndp-max-entry.name: ndp-max-entry
ndp-max-entry.help: Maximum number of NDP table entries (set to 65,536 or higher; if set to 0, kernel holds 65,536 entries).

br-fdb-max-entry.name: br-fdb-max-entry
br-fdb-max-entry.help: Maximum number of bridge forwarding database (FDB) entries.

max-route-cache-size.name: max-route-cache-size
max-route-cache-size.help: Maximum number of IP route cache entries (0 - 2147483647).

ipsec-qat-offload.name: ipsec-qat-offload
ipsec-qat-offload.help: Enable/disable QAT offloading (Intel QuickAssist) for IPsec VPN traffic. QuickAssist can accelerate IPsec encryption and decryption.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable QAT offload for IPsec VPN.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable QAT offload for IPsec VPN.
options.label: Disable

device-idle-timeout.name: device-idle-timeout
device-idle-timeout.help: Time in seconds that a device must be idle to automatically log the device user out. (30 - 31536000 sec (30 sec to 1 year), default = 300).

user-device-store-max-devices.name: user-device-store-max-devices
user-device-store-max-devices.help: Maximum number of devices allowed in user device store.

user-device-store-max-device-mem.name: user-device-store-max-device-mem
user-device-store-max-device-mem.help: Maximum percentage of total system memory allowed to be used for devices in the user device store.

user-device-store-max-users.name: user-device-store-max-users
user-device-store-max-users.help: Maximum number of users allowed in user device store.

user-device-store-max-unified-mem.name: user-device-store-max-unified-mem
user-device-store-max-unified-mem.help: Maximum unified memory allowed in user device store.

gui-device-latitude.name: gui-device-latitude
gui-device-latitude.help: Add the latitude of the location of this FortiGate to position it on the Threat Map.

gui-device-longitude.name: gui-device-longitude
gui-device-longitude.help: Add the longitude of the location of this FortiGate to position it on the Threat Map.

private-data-encryption.name: private-data-encryption
private-data-encryption.help: Enable/disable private data encryption using an AES 128-bit key or passpharse.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable private data encryption using an AES 128-bit key.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable private data encryption using an AES 128-bit key

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable private data encryption using an AES 128-bit key.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable private data encryption using an AES 128-bit key

auto-auth-extension-device.name: auto-auth-extension-device
auto-auth-extension-device.help: Enable/disable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension devices.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension device globally.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension device globally

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension device globally.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable automatic authorization of dedicated Fortinet extension device globally

gui-theme.name: gui-theme
gui-theme.help: Color scheme for the administration GUI.

gui-date-format.name: gui-date-format
gui-date-format.help: Default date format used throughout GUI.

gui-date-time-source.name: gui-date-time-source
gui-date-time-source.help: Source from which the FortiGate GUI uses to display date and time entries.

options.name: system
options.help: Use this FortiGate unit's configured timezone.
options.label: System
options.description: Use this FortiGate unit's configured timezone

igmp-state-limit.name: igmp-state-limit
igmp-state-limit.help: Maximum number of IGMP memberships (96 - 64000, default = 3200).

ipsec-ha-seqjump-rate.name: ipsec-ha-seqjump-rate
ipsec-ha-seqjump-rate.help: ESP jump ahead rate (1G - 10G pps equivalent).

fortitoken-cloud-push-status.name: fortitoken-cloud-push-status
fortitoken-cloud-push-status.help: Enable/disable FTM push service of FortiToken Cloud.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable FTM push service of FortiToken Cloud.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable FTM push service of FortiToken Cloud

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable FTM push service of FortiToken Cloud.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable FTM push service of FortiToken Cloud

fortitoken-cloud-region.name: fortitoken-cloud-region
fortitoken-cloud-region.help: Region domain of FortiToken Cloud(unset to non-region).

fortitoken-cloud-sync-interval.name: fortitoken-cloud-sync-interval
fortitoken-cloud-sync-interval.help: Interval in which to clean up remote users in FortiToken Cloud (0 - 336 hours (14 days), default = 24, disable = 0).

faz-disk-buffer-size.name: faz-disk-buffer-size
faz-disk-buffer-size.help: Maximum disk buffer size to temporarily store logs destined for FortiAnalyzer. To be used in the event that FortiAnalyzer is unavailable.

irq-time-accounting.name: irq-time-accounting
irq-time-accounting.help: Configure CPU IRQ time accounting mode.

options.name: force
options.help: Force the use of CPU IRQ time accounting mode.
options.label: Force
options.description: Force the use of CPU IRQ time accounting mode

management-ip.name: management-ip
management-ip.help: Management IP address of this FortiGate. Used to log into this FortiGate from another FortiGate in the Security Fabric.

management-port.name: management-port
management-port.help: Overriding port for management connection (Overrides admin port).

management-port-use-admin-sport.name: management-port-use-admin-sport
management-port-use-admin-sport.help: Enable/disable use of the admin-sport setting for the management port. If disabled, FortiGate will allow user to specify management-port.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable use of the admin-sport setting for the management port.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable use of the admin-sport setting for the management port

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable use of the admin-sport setting for the management port.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable use of the admin-sport setting for the management port

options.name: once
options.help: Enable one-time config upload to FortiConverter.
options.label: Once
options.description: Enable one-time config upload to FortiConverter

internet-service-database.name: internet-service-database
internet-service-database.help: Configure which Internet Service database size to download from FortiGuard and use.

options.name: mini
options.help: Small sized Internet Service database with very limited IP addresses.
options.label: Mini
options.description: Small sized Internet Service database with very limited IP addresses

options.name: standard
options.help: Medium sized Internet Service database with most IP addresses.
options.label: Standard
options.description: Medium sized Internet Service database with most IP addresses

options.name: full
options.help: Full sized Internet Service database with all IP addresses.
options.label: Full
options.description: Full sized Internet Service database with all IP addresses

options.name: on-demand
options.help: Internet Service database with customer selected IP addresses.
options.label: On Demand
options.description: Internet Service database with customer selected IP addresses

internet-service-download-list.name: internet-service-download-list
internet-service-download-list.help: Configure which on-demand Internet Service IDs are to be downloaded.

geoip-full-db.name: geoip-full-db
geoip-full-db.help: When enabled, the full geographic database will be loaded into the kernel which enables geographic information in traffic logs - required for FortiView countries. Disabling this option will conserve memory.

options.name: enable
options.help: Full GeoDB will be downloaded. FortiView countries can be used.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Full GeoDB will not be downloaded. FortiView countries cannot be used.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Full GeoDB will not be downloaded

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable early TCP NPU session in order to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable early TCP NPU session in order to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable early TCP NPU session in order to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable early TCP NPU session in order to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake

npu-neighbor-update.name: npu-neighbor-update
npu-neighbor-update.help: Enable/disable sending of ARP/ICMP6 probing packets to update neighbors for offloaded sessions.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable sending of ARP/ICMP6 probing packets to update neighbors for offloaded sessions.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable sending of ARP/ICMP6 probing packets to update neighbors for offloaded sessions

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable sending of ARP/ICMP6 probing packets to update neighbors for offloaded sessions.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable sending of ARP/ICMP6 probing packets to update neighbors for offloaded sessions

delay-tcp-npu-session.name: delay-tcp-npu-session
delay-tcp-npu-session.help: Enable TCP NPU session delay to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable TCP NPU session delay in order to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable TCP NPU session delay in order to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable TCP NPU session delay in order to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable TCP NPU session delay in order to guarantee packet order of 3-way handshake

interface-subnet-usage.name: interface-subnet-usage
interface-subnet-usage.help: Enable/disable allowing use of interface-subnet setting in firewall addresses (default = enable).

options.name: disable
options.help: Disallow use of the interface-subnet setting in firewall addresses. Use in conjunction with the FortiGate REST API and when a large number of firewall addresses exist in the configuration.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disallow use of the interface-subnet setting in firewall addresses

options.name: enable
options.help: Allow use of the interface-subnet setting in firewall addresses.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Allow use of the interface-subnet setting in firewall addresses

sflowd-max-children-num.name: sflowd-max-children-num
sflowd-max-children-num.help: Maximum number of sflowd child processes allowed to run.

fortigslb-integration.name: fortigslb-integration
fortigslb-integration.help: Enable/disable integration with the FortiGSLB cloud service.

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable VIP and ZTNA server integration with the FortiGSLB cloud service.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable VIP and ZTNA server integration with the FortiGSLB cloud service

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable VIP and ZTNA server integration with the FortiGSLB cloud service.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable VIP and ZTNA server integration with the FortiGSLB cloud service

user-history-password-threshold.name: user-history-password-threshold
user-history-password-threshold.help: Maximum number of previous passwords saved per admin/user (3 - 15, default = 3).

auth-session-auto-backup.name: auth-session-auto-backup
auth-session-auto-backup.help: Enable/disable automatic and periodic backup of authentication sessions (default = disable). Sessions are restored upon bootup.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable periodic backup of authentication sessions.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable periodic backup of authentication sessions

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable periodic backup of authentication sessions.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable periodic backup of authentication sessions

auth-session-auto-backup-interval.name: auth-session-auto-backup-interval
auth-session-auto-backup-interval.help: Configure automatic authentication session backup interval (default = 15min).

scim-server-cert.name: scim-server-cert
scim-server-cert.help: Server certificate that the FortiGate uses for SCIM connections.
